summary: Email chain from November 2001 discussing Jeffrey Epstein's search for a female exercise instructor, with specific requirements that she be young, attractive, and willing to come to his house. The emails reveal Epstein's preferences and the efforts of associates to find suitable candidates.

persons.name: Gibby Cohen
persons.role: Associate helping to find an exercise instructor
persons.context: Email recipient who is being asked to help find a female exercise instructor for Jeffrey Epstein, with specific requirements about age and appearance.

persons.name: G. Max
persons.role: Person coordinating the search for an exercise instructor for Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Email sender who is urgently seeking a female exercise instructor for Jeffrey Epstein, specifying that she must be young, attractive, and willing to come to his house to maintain his interest.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as 'JE', he is looking for a female exercise instructor to come to his house, with specific preferences for someone young and attractive.

connections.description: G. Max is requesting Gibby Cohen's help in finding a female exercise instructor for Jeffrey Epstein, indicating a collaborative or task-oriented relationship.
G. Max is acting on behalf of Jeffrey Epstein to find an exercise instructor, suggesting a service or assistance relationship.
Gibby Cohen is being asked to help find an exercise instructor for Jeffrey Epstein, indicating an indirect connection or network relationship.

events.title: Initial request for exercise instructor
events.description: G. Max emails Gibby Cohen asking for help finding a female exercise instructor for Jeffrey Epstein, specifying requirements for someone young and attractive to come to his house.

events.title: Follow-up on instructor search
events.description: Email exchange continues regarding the search for an exercise instructor, with Gibby Cohen reporting no success yet and G. Max emphasizing reliance on Gibby's help.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was seeking a female exercise instructor in November 2001 who was 'youngish and attractive' and willing to come to his house.
The search was coordinated by an associate, G. Max, who specified that Epstein would 'loose interest rapidly' if the instructor did not meet these appearance criteria.
The emails reveal a pattern of Epstein using associates to recruit young women under the guise of legitimate services like exercise instruction.
